page.title: 06HARDWICK VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: The building which housed the{village {school}is now a private house. It is situated next tp the church and is quite near the Manor Farm. The windows of the building are similar to those found in the church. From the window on the east side of the building can be seen a view of the churchyard. Above this window, on the gable, is the bell which was used for calling the children of the village to the school. The old school building looks like the church because it was a church school. It was built in 1870 for a roll of 50 children, but the average attendance fell over the years. In 1870 it was 22, in 1874 20 and between 1898 and 1903 it fell to 18. In 1905 the school was closed so the children went to school in the village of Little Harrowden, a few miles away.
